uk.ac.kcl.inf.provoking.builder

Interface AbbreviationResolver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    URIPrefixResolver, URISchemeResolver

    public interface AbbreviationResolver
    Text abbreviations can be used in building. For examples, "ex:myentity" may be an abbreviation for the URL http://www.example.com#entity", while "/Yesterday/" might be an abbreviation for a Date object denoting yesterday. An AbbreviationResolver is used in building to convert from an abbreviation to the resolved form. Resolvers must be registered with the ProvBuilder using the addResolver method in order to be applied. For the common case of resolving a prefixed qualified name to a URI, the setPrefix method is an convenient alternative that creates and registers the appropriate resolver.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean appliesTo(java.lang.String abbreviation)
      Should return true if this resolver can resolve the given string.
      java.lang.Object resolve(java.lang.String abbreviation)
      For a string this resolver can resolve, return the resolved form.

    • Method Detail

      • appliesTo

        boolean appliesTo(java.lang.String abbreviation)
        Should return true if this resolver can resolve the given string.
        Parameters:
        abbreviation - The potentially abbreviated text.
        Returns:
        True if this resolver can resolve the abbreviated text, or false otherwise.

      • resolve

        java.lang.Object resolve(java.lang.String abbreviation)
                         throws ProvBuildException
        For a string this resolver can resolve, return the resolved form.
        Parameters:
        abbreviation - The abbreviated text.
        Returns:
        The resolved form of the abbreviated text, if this resolver can resolve the abbreviation, or an undefined value otherwise.
        Throws:
        ProvBuildException - If the attempt to resolve failed, usually due to the text being malformed in some way.
